isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-6613 SERIES - MAINTENANCE

svcproc.title: MAINTENANCE
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 2 for the following items.

step1.para: Air System and Connections. Check for leaks, worn air lines, loose connections and bolts. Refer to AIR SYSTEM
Clutch Housing Mounting. Check clutch housing bolts for looseness.

Clutch Release Bearing. Remove hand hole cover and check the radial and axial clearance of the release bearing. Check relative position of thrust surface of release bearing with thrust sleeve on push-type clutches.
Clutch Pedal Shaft and Bores. Pry upward on shafts to check wear. If excessive movement is found, remove the clutch release mechanism and check bushings in bores and wear on shafts.
Lubricant. Change at specified service intervals. Use only the types and grades as recommended in GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Fill and Drain Plugs. Remove fill plugs and check level of lubricant at specified intervals. Tighten fill and drain plugs securely.
Gear Shift Lever. Check for looseness and free play in the housing. If the lever is loose in the housing, proceed with Step 8.

Gear Shift Lever Housing Assembly. Remove the air lines at the air valve and remove the gear shift lever housing assembly from the transmission. Check the tension spring and washer for set and wear. Check the gear shift lever pivot pin and slot for wear. Check the bottom end of the gear shift lever for wear and check the slot of yokes and blocks in the shifter housing for wear at contact points with the shift lever.

Universal Joint Companion Flange Nut (Not Shown). Check for tightness. Tighten to recommended torque. Refer to the TORQUE CHART
.
Splines on the Output Shaft (Not Shown). Check for wear from movement and chucking action of the universal joint companion flange.
Mainshaft Rear Bearing Cover (Not Shown). Check the oil seal for wear.
Output Shaft (Not Shown). Pry upward against the output shaft to check the radial clearance in the mainshaft rear bearing.
